comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

When you open multiple tabs in full screen mode, and then close all but the last one, the right hand scroll bar is drawn partly off screen. The top button ("up arrow") is not shown any more, and some pixels of the content are also cropped.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open two tabs, and load any page in them.
2. Go to full screen mode (F11).
3. Wait for the tab and menu bars to scroll away.
4. Close the current tab (F4), so only one is left.
5. You will now lost a few pixels from the top of the content, and the top of the scroll bar.



I have the following (among others) changes in about:config.
browser.tabs.autoHide = true
browser.tabs.closeButtons = 3
browser.tabs.closeWindowWithLastTab = false
